website_summaries.verdict: An ergonomically designed ball hammer valued for its strength and effectiveness in a number of use cases.
pros: Reliable fiberglass handle and core for strength and vibration reduction
Use it to strike chisels and for metalwork
cons: It comes from a lesser-known brand

customer_reviews.title: Dang Nice Hammer...recommended
customer_reviews.text: This is as good a ball peen hammer as you can buy...better than the Vaughn ball peen hammers at the big box stores...and cheaper. Great feel...well balanced...nice head weight...well made. The rubberized fiberglass handle is very nice. I paid $2.00 less for this hammer than a 16 oz Craftsman with a wooden handle. Hammers are hammers generally...so the difference is in the handle and grip. Get this one. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Ball part is not round and won’t leave a nice indent
customer_reviews.text: Really upset about this one. The ball part is not round and has imperfections. I don’t have the tools to round it out so instead of a round dent, it is triangular wedge dent. Really bad quality control but it seems sturdy and could have been good.
customer_reviews.author: Heidi McKnight

customer_reviews.title: Wasn't Expecting Much For Price !
customer_reviews.text: Guess what? This is a really good feeling hammer I break stuff for a living so I don't like to spend much on hammers. New company policy made me ditch my wood hammer so I bought this. I have used daily for a month now this will serve my purpose for sometime. Easy to clean.
customer_reviews.author: Wingjockey

customer_reviews.title: This hammer is well build and has a nice grip to it
customer_reviews.text: This hammer is well build and has a nice grip to it. I wasn't expecting much from a 10 dollar hammer but this hammer exceeded my expectation. 24oz is a good size for all around work. I used to use those 12 oz claw hammer to hammer down the nails but with this 24oz things are lot easier. It's a must have tool for your home workshop.
customer_reviews.author: Tander Shivley

customer_reviews.text: So, I got this because I needed a heavier hammer for my forge that wouldn't break the bank. It is well worth the price and then some. My only critique is that the fiberglass handle feels a little too light and I have to choke up on the handle for the control I need.

product_meta.title: TopBulit 24 Ounce Ball Pein Hammer with Fiberglass Handle 25032
product_meta.description:
The TOPBUILT ball pein hammer combines a forged steel head on a new designed fiberglass handle. Ball pein is ideal for punching,riveting,shaping and bending. 

Forged steel head for superior strength and durability. 
Unified fiberglass handle fixed with epoxy resin. 
Fiberglass core adds strength and help reduce vibrations. 
Ergonomic comfortable grip prevent slippage. 
Ball pein is ideal for striking chisels and punches or riveting,shaping and bending metal.
